channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Jury: A Comprehensive Evaluation Toolkit
item.description: However, the vast number of Natural Language Processing (NLP) tasks and the development of various metrics have led to challenges in evaluating different systems with different metrics.

item.title: Editing Personality for LLMs
item.description: This task seeks to adjust the models' responses to opinion-related questions on specified topics since an individual's personality often manifests in the form of their expressed opinions, thereby showcasing different personality traits.

item.title: Towards End-to-End Embodied Decision Making via Multi-modal Large Language Model: Explorations with GPT4-Vision and Beyond
item.description: In this study, we explore the potential of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) in improving embodied decision-making processes for agents.

item.title: Instance Needs More Care: Rewriting Prompts for Instances Yields Better Zero-Shot Performance
item.description: To this end, we propose PRoMPTd, an approach that rewrites the task prompt for each individual test input to be more specific, unambiguous, and complete, so as to provide better guidance to the task LLM.

item.title: MiniGPT-5: Interleaved Vision-and-Language Generation via Generative Vokens
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have garnered significant attention for their advancements in natural language processing, demonstrating unparalleled prowess in text comprehension and generation.

item.title: Generative Autoencoding of Dropout Patterns
item.description: We propose a generative model termed Deciphering Autoencoders.

item.title: Language Models as Knowledge Bases for Visual Word Sense Disambiguation
item.description: Visual Word Sense Disambiguation (VWSD) is a novel challenging task that lies between linguistic sense disambiguation and fine-grained multimodal retrieval.

item.title: Probabilistic Reach-Avoid for Bayesian Neural Networks
item.description: Such computed lower bounds provide safety certification for the given policy and BNN model.

item.title: Towards Stable Backdoor Purification through Feature Shift Tuning
item.description: Therefore, it is necessary to disentangle the backdoor and clean features in order to improve backdoor purification.

item.title: Differentially Encoded Observation Spaces for Perceptive Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We evaluate our approach with three state-of-the-art DRL algorithms and find that differential image encoding reduces the memory footprint by as much as 14. 2x and 16. 7x across tasks from the Atari 2600 benchmark and the DeepMind Control Suite (DMC) respectively.

item.title: Mini-BEHAVIOR: A Procedurally Generated Benchmark for Long-horizon Decision-Making in Embodied AI
item.description: We present Mini-BEHAVIOR, a novel benchmark for embodied AI that challenges agents to use reasoning and decision-making skills to solve complex activities that resemble everyday human challenges.

item.title: Ensemble Distillation for Unsupervised Constituency Parsing
item.description: We investigate the unsupervised constituency parsing task, which organizes words and phrases of a sentence into a hierarchical structure without using linguistically annotated data.

item.title: Unveiling the Pitfalls of Knowledge Editing for Large Language Models
item.description: This paper pioneers the investigation into the potential pitfalls associated with knowledge editing for LLMs.

item.title: Language Models Represent Space and Time
item.description: The capabilities of large language models (LLMs) have sparked debate over whether such systems just learn an enormous collection of superficial statistics or a coherent model of the data generating process -- a world model.

item.title: LanguageBind: Extending Video-Language Pretraining to N-modality by Language-based Semantic Alignment
item.description: While LanguageBind ensures that we can extend VL modalities to N modalities, we also need a high-quality dataset with alignment data pairs centered on language.

item.title: OceanGPT: A Large Language Model for Ocean Science Tasks
item.description: Ocean science, which delves into the oceans that are reservoirs of life and biodiversity, is of great significance given that oceans cover over 70% of our planet's surface.

item.title: Video Transformers under Occlusion: How Physics and Background Attributes Impact Large Models for Robotic Manipulation
item.description: As transformer architectures and dataset sizes continue to scale, the need to understand the specific dataset factors affecting model performance becomes increasingly urgent.

item.title: Robust deformable image registration using cycle-consistent implicit representations
item.description: To improve robustness, we propose a deformable registration method using pairs of cycle-consistent Implicit Neural Representations: each implicit representation is linked to a second implicit representation that estimates the opposite transformation, causing each network to act as a regularizer for its paired opposite.

item.title: Exploring Collaboration Mechanisms for LLM Agents: A Social Psychology View
item.description: This paper probes the collaboration mechanisms among contemporary NLP systems by melding practical experiments with theoretical insights.

item.title: Learning and reusing primitive behaviours to improve Hindsight Experience Replay sample efficiency
item.description: Hindsight Experience Replay (HER) is a technique used in reinforcement learning (RL) that has proven to be very efficient for training off-policy RL-based agents to solve goal-based robotic manipulation tasks using sparse rewards.

item.title: Stack Attention: Improving the Ability of Transformers to Model Hierarchical Patterns
item.description: Attention, specifically scaled dot-product attention, has proven effective for natural language, but it does not have a mechanism for handling hierarchical patterns of arbitrary nesting depth, which limits its ability to recognize certain syntactic structures.

item.title: VENOM: A Vectorized N:M Format for Unleashing the Power of Sparse Tensor Cores
item.description: We present the V:N:M format, which enables the execution of arbitrary N:M ratios on SPTCs.

item.title: SMRD: SURE-based Robust MRI Reconstruction with Diffusion Models
item.description: However, diffusion models require careful tuning of inference hyperparameters on a validation set and are still sensitive to distribution shifts during testing.

item.title: Self-Supervised High Dynamic Range Imaging with Multi-Exposure Images in Dynamic Scenes
item.description: The color component is estimated from aligned multi-exposure images, while the structure one is generated through a structure-focused network that is supervised by the color component and an input reference (\eg, medium-exposure) image.

item.title: Shifting More Attention to Breast Lesion Segmentation in Ultrasound Videos
item.description: We also devise a localization-based contrastive loss to reduce the lesion location distance between neighboring video frames within the same video and enlarge the location distances between frames from different ultrasound videos.

item.title: Learning Quantum Processes with Quantum Statistical Queries
item.description: Learning complex quantum processes is a central challenge in many areas of quantum computing and quantum machine learning, with applications in quantum benchmarking, cryptanalysis, and variational quantum algorithms.

item.title: Towards Feasible Counterfactual Explanations: A Taxonomy Guided Template-based NLG Method
item.description: Counterfactual Explanations (cf-XAI) describe the smallest changes in feature values necessary to change an outcome from one class to another.

item.title: Driving with LLMs: Fusing Object-Level Vector Modality for Explainable Autonomous Driving
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown promise in the autonomous driving sector, particularly in generalization and interpretability.

item.title: EMBERSim: A Large-Scale Databank for Boosting Similarity Search in Malware Analysis
item.description: In recent years there has been a shift from heuristics-based malware detection towards machine learning, which proves to be more robust in the current heavily adversarial threat landscape.

item.title: FiGURe: Simple and Efficient Unsupervised Node Representations with Filter Augmentations
item.description: This paper presents a simple filter-based augmentation method to capture different parts of the eigen-spectrum.

item.title: TransRadar: Adaptive-Directional Transformer for Real-Time Multi-View Radar Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Scene understanding plays an essential role in enabling autonomous driving and maintaining high standards of performance and safety.

item.title: Leveraging Classic Deconvolution and Feature Extraction in Zero-Shot Image Restoration
item.description: Our approach combines a pre-trained network to extract deep features from the input image with iterative Richardson-Lucy deconvolution steps.

item.title: On the Generalization of Training-based ChatGPT Detection Methods
item.description: ChatGPT is one of the most popular language models which achieve amazing performance on various natural language tasks.

item.title: Towards Robust Cardiac Segmentation using Graph Convolutional Networks
item.description: We propose a graph architecture that uses two convolutional rings based on cardiac anatomy and show that this eliminates anatomical incorrect multi-structure segmentations on the publicly available CAMUS dataset.

item.title: Reasoning on Graphs: Faithful and Interpretable Large Language Model Reasoning
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel method called reasoning on graphs (RoG) that synergizes LLMs with KGs to enable faithful and interpretable reasoning.

item.title: Diagnosis and Prognosis of Faults in High-Speed Aeronautical Bearings with a Collaborative Selection Incremental Deep Transfer Learning Approach
item.description: The diagnosis and prognosis of aeronautical-bearing health conditions are essential to proactively ensuring efficient power transmission, safety, and reduced downtime.

item.title: Harnessing the Power of Choices in Decision Tree Learning
item.description: We propose a simple generalization of standard and empirically successful decision tree learning algorithms such as ID3, C4. 5, and CART.

item.title: LLM Lies: Hallucinations are not Bugs, but Features as Adversarial Examples
item.description: This phenomenon forces us to revisit that hallucination may be another view of adversarial examples, and it shares similar features with conventional adversarial examples as the basic feature of LLMs.

item.title: Making Retrieval-Augmented Language Models Robust to Irrelevant Context
item.description: An important desideratum of RALMs, is that retrieved information helps model performance when it is relevant, and does not harm performance when it is not.

item.title: On Training Derivative-Constrained Neural Networks
item.description: We refer to the setting where the (partial) derivatives of a neural network's (NN's) predictions with respect to its inputs are used as additional training signal as a derivative-constrained (DC) NN.

item.title: Zero-Shot Continuous Prompt Transfer: Generalizing Task Semantics Across Language Models
item.description: Prompt tuning in natural language processing (NLP) has become an increasingly popular method for adapting large language models to specific tasks.

item.title: CAT-LM: Training Language Models on Aligned Code And Tests
item.description: We also drastically increase the maximum sequence length of inputs to 8, 192 tokens, 4x more than typical code generation models, to ensure that the code context is available to the model when generating test code.

item.title: Active Learning on Neural Networks through Interactive Generation of Digit Patterns and Visual Representation
item.description: In this paper, to improve users' learning and understanding of NNs, an interactive learning system is designed to create digit patterns and recognize them in real time.

item.title: Bridging the Gap between Structural and Semantic Similarity in Diverse Planning
item.description: In this work, we propose two new domain-independent metrics which are able to capture relevant information on the difference between two given plans from a domain-dependent viewpoint.

item.title: An Investigation of Representation and Allocation Harms in Contrastive Learning
item.description: In this paper, we demonstrate that contrastive learning (CL), a popular variant of SSL, tends to collapse representations of minority groups with certain majority groups.

item.title: Tensor Ring Optimized Quantum-Enhanced Tensor Neural Networks
item.description: Quantum machine learning researchers often rely on incorporating Tensor Networks (TN) into Deep Neural Networks (DNN) and variational optimization.

item.title: Forecasting Tropical Cyclones with Cascaded Diffusion Models
item.description: As cyclones become more intense due to climate change, the rise of AI-based modelling provides a more affordable and accessible approach compared to traditional methods based on mathematical models.

item.title: Controlling Vision-Language Models for Universal Image Restoration
item.description: In this paper, we present a degradation-aware vision-language model (DA-CLIP) to better transfer pretrained vision-language models to low-level vision tasks as a universal framework for image restoration.

item.title: PC-NeRF: Parent-Child Neural Radiance Fields under Partial Sensor Data Loss in Autonomous Driving Environments
item.description: Reconstructing large-scale 3D scenes is essential for autonomous vehicles, especially when partial sensor data is lost.

item.title: Direct Inversion: Boosting Diffusion-based Editing with 3 Lines of Code
item.description: Specifically, in the context of diffusion-based editing, where a source image is edited according to a target prompt, the process commences by acquiring a noisy latent vector corresponding to the source image via the diffusion model.
